disrupted. Ladies and gentlemen, overloaded vehicles are
one of the common traffic violations
in Ho Chi Minh City.  To help
overcome this situation, the Department of
Transport has piloted a
new application to install automatic load weighing stations
in gateway areas where vehicles passing through,
if violating the load, they will be issued a fine.
Automatic load weighing stations are
piloted in the city's gateway areas
such as Ong Lon bridge, District 7,
An Xuong An Lac toll station, Binh Tan district
with data collection time of 24/24
only.  In large traffic areas, every
day there are nearly 10 vehicles violating the
allowed load limit. The system will automatically weigh the
load of each axle and transmit
data to the operator center to
review the vehicles.  If there are signs
of violation, it is necessary to extract resources. Lap is underweight and
transferred to the
Ho Chi Minh City transportation inspection to ensure fairness
and transparency. This is one of the advantages
of this new system, which saves
personnel and costs money.  With such technology,
human intervention in the process of
vehicle inspection and handling of violations
is generally very little, so it is
effective as well as transparent.  The
pilot of
automatic load weighing equipment will be
conducted for 1 year with the goal of minimizing
the situation of trucks moving into the
Ho Chi Minh City area, thereby ensuring
safety for people.  as well as reducing

a robotic hand with full
lifelike details is a product that marks
the cooperation between manufacturers.  researched by the
Swiss Federal Institute of Technology and a
company specializing in 3D printing in the US,
this robotic hand was created using
new 3D printing technology that combines many different high-quality materials.
New printing technology by the company inbit
Development can 3D print
soft, elastic and hard materials at the same time, allowing the creation of
complex structures such as
ligament joints and tendons of the hand
instead of 3D printing in the usual way of printing in
layers in one step.  This new technology can print
all the details in
a model at once with high precision. The
team also used a
new 3D laser scanner to inspect the finished product and
immediately detect
abnormalities.  All of this happens with just
one printing process which helps Achieve the level of
precision needed with these robotic hands
because we have the ability to capture and design a
hand for the person who needs it so this will be
a step towards  to custom-
